column4: is there some sort of image browser in ubuntu that will create thumbnails of a directory of large images?
I thought the built in nautilus/whatever does that
but you can run 'gphoto' and many other tools... depends what you want
i don't think it stores thumbnails
or theres many other tools... experiment... backup files first just in case etc. ;-)
i don't see it the repo, thers gphoto2?
maybe im triking of the wrong tool but I think thats it
maybe that doesnt do what you want... i dont know!
from the description it seems for downloading imgs from cameras ;-)
experiment... i could be wrong thing.. i cant remember...
that's the whole point of asking is not to experiment with a bunch of programs ;-) all i want is to browse a folder with images heh
nautilus does not store thumbnails like windows does
except it will take about half an hour to generate thumbnails for a lot of large images ;)
